Loss from Variable Dropout

Loss from Variable Dropout

Loss from Variable Dropout

variable_importance(explainer, loss_function = loss_sum_of_squares, ...,
  type = "raw", n_sample = 1000)

Arguments

explainer

a model to be explained, preprocessed by the 'explain' function
loss_function

a function thet will be used to assess variable importance
...

other parameters
type

character, type of transformation that should be applied for dropout loss. 'raw' results raw drop lossess, 'ratio' returns drop_loss/drop_loss_full_model while 'difference' returns drop_loss - drop_loss_full_model
n_sample

number of observations that should be sampled for calculation of variable importance. If negative then variable importance will be calculated on whole dataset (no sampling).

Value

An object of the class 'variable_leverage_explainer'. It's a data frame with calculated average response.

Examples

 
library("breakDown")
library("randomForest")
HR_rf_model <- randomForest(left~., data = breakDown::HR_data, ntree = 100)
#> Warning: The response has five or fewer unique values.  Are you sure you want to do regression?
explainer_rf  <- explain(HR_rf_model, data = HR_data, y = HR_data$left)
vd_rf <- variable_importance(explainer_rf, type = "raw")
vd_rf
#>                 variable dropout_loss        label
#> 1           _full_model_     2.039184 randomForest
#> 2                   left     2.039184 randomForest
#> 3  promotion_last_5years     2.092500 randomForest
#> 4          Work_accident     2.883440 randomForest
#> 5                 salary     3.955588 randomForest
#> 6                  sales     6.574528 randomForest
#> 7     time_spend_company    84.305951 randomForest
#> 8   average_montly_hours    98.023619 randomForest
#> 9        last_evaluation   104.754923 randomForest
#> 10        number_project   121.175387 randomForest
#> 11    satisfaction_level   173.359981 randomForest
#> 12            _baseline_   378.533616 randomForest

HR_glm_model <- glm(left~., data = breakDown::HR_data, family = "binomial")
explainer_glm <- explain(HR_glm_model, data = HR_data, y = HR_data$left)
logit <- function(x) exp(x)/(1+exp(x))
vd_glm <- variable_importance(explainer_glm, type = "raw",
                        loss_function = function(observed, predicted)
                                     sum((observed - logit(predicted))^2))
vd_glm
#>                 variable dropout_loss label
#> 1           _full_model_     266.6337    lm
#> 2        last_evaluation     266.5416    lm
#> 3                   left     266.6337    lm
#> 4  promotion_last_5years     266.8123    lm
#> 5                  sales     266.8233    lm
#> 6         number_project     267.0625    lm
#> 7   average_montly_hours     267.2953    lm
#> 8     time_spend_company     267.6800    lm
#> 9          Work_accident     268.5647    lm
#> 10                salary     269.1463    lm
#> 11    satisfaction_level     280.6456    lm
#> 12            _baseline_     285.4526    lm

library("xgboost")
model_martix_train <- model.matrix(left~.-1, breakDown::HR_data)
data_train <- xgb.DMatrix(model_martix_train, label = breakDown::HR_data$left)
param <- list(max_depth = 2, eta = 1, silent = 1, nthread = 2,
              objective = "binary:logistic", eval_metric = "auc")
HR_xgb_model <- xgb.train(param, data_train, nrounds = 50)
explainer_xgb <- explain(HR_xgb_model, data = model_martix_train,
                     y = HR_data$left, label = "xgboost")
vd_xgb <- variable_importance(explainer_xgb, type = "raw")
vd_xgb
#>                 variable dropout_loss   label
#> 1           _full_model_     19.01078 xgboost
#> 2  promotion_last_5years     18.88517 xgboost
#> 3         salestechnical     18.92286 xgboost
#> 4             salessales     19.00140 xgboost
#> 5        salesaccounting     19.01078 xgboost
#> 6                salesIT     19.01078 xgboost
#> 7        salesmanagement     19.01078 xgboost
#> 8         salesmarketing     19.01078 xgboost
#> 9                saleshr     19.04168 xgboost
#> 10          salessupport     19.15879 xgboost
#> 11      salesproduct_mng     19.28696 xgboost
#> 12            salesRandD     19.41833 xgboost
#> 13          salarymedium     19.92235 xgboost
#> 14             salarylow     20.00753 xgboost
#> 15         Work_accident     20.99561 xgboost
#> 16        number_project     42.79207 xgboost
#> 17  average_montly_hours     43.76106 xgboost
#> 18       last_evaluation     47.36876 xgboost
#> 19    time_spend_company     74.42228 xgboost
#> 20    satisfaction_level    136.30899 xgboost
#> 21            _baseline_    319.64602 xgboost
plot(vd_xgb)
